channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft turns 50 as the world’s second largest company—trying not to fall behind on AI
item.description: Microsoft has been at the heart of computing for half a century, becoming a tech stalwart almost taken for granted as lifestyles embraced the internet...

item.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian signals no exit yet—but hints at succession plan
item.description: Delta CEO Ed Bastian, 67, is nearing his ninth year at the airline's helm.

item.title: Uncertainty Torments Afghan Refugees Facing Deportation from Pakistan
item.description: Monday marks the deadline for Afghans sheltering in Pakistan to leave the country, with the prospect of a dangerous future in Taliban-led Afghanistan ...

item.title: Volvo Car brings back Samuelsson as CEO to steer turnaround
item.description: Hakan Samuelsson's reappointment as CEO sees ex-Dyson boss Jim Rowan evicted from the role after just three years.

item.title: Trump ‘Not Joking’ About Third Term, and the Myanmar Earthquake Toll
item.description: Plus, trying the impossible at the Olympics.

item.title: Musk Gives $1 Million Checks to Voters Amid Wisconsin Court Race
item.description: Elon Musk campaigned on Sunday in Green Bay for a state Supreme Court candidate he has spent lavishly to support — but who did not attend his event.

item.title: Trump’s Social Security nominee is a Fortune 500 CEO. Will he fix the agency’s customer-service problems, or run afoul of Musk’s war on costs?
item.description: Fiserv CEO Frank Bisignano has the credentials to upgrade Social Security, but faces broad distrust because of DOGE's cuts.

item.title: Marine Le Pen Found Guilty of Embezzlement by French Court
item.description: The ruling could complicate the plans of the far-right leader to run for president in 2027.

item.title: Israel Issues Evacuation Order for Southern Gaza
item.description: The order, which came during the Eid al-Fitr holiday, included Rafah and parts of neighboring Khan Younis.

item.title: Microsoft’s memorable cultural legacies at 50, from Clippy to the Blue Screen of Death
item.description: Every one of its design decision is felt around the world for better or worse—often staying with people for years as a fond memory or a meme.

item.title: Uncertainty Torments Afghan Refugees Facing Deportation from Pakistan
item.description: Monday marks the deadline for Afghans sheltering in Pakistan to leave the country, with the prospect of a dangerous future in Taliban-led Afghanistan ...

item.title: Israel Issues Evacuation Order for Southern Gaza
item.description: The order, which came during the Eid al-Fitr holiday, included Rafah and parts of neighboring Khan Younis.

item.title: How Trump Supercharged Distrust, Driving U.S. Allies Away
item.description: Trust is very hard to build and easy to destroy. America and its partners are caught in a spiral of distrust.

item.title: Israel Digs In Beyond Its Northern Border
item.description: Israel has built a growing network of outposts and fortifications in Syria and Lebanon, deepening concerns about a protracted occupation in parts of t...

item.title: Marine Le Pen Found Guilty of Embezzlement by French Court
item.description: The ruling could complicate the plans of the far-right leader to run for president in 2027.
